BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: PEAK TO PEAK CHARTER SCHOOLS INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OFFER CHILDREN OF BOULDER VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT A UNIQUE PUBLIC GRADE K-12 EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO OFFER CHILDREN OF BOULDER VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT A UNIQUE KINDERGARTEN THROUGH TWELFTH GRADE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDED CHALLENGING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND LEARNING FACILITIES TO MORE THAN 1,400 SCHOOL AGED (KINDERGARTEN THROUGH TWELFTH GRADE) CHILDREN IN BOULDER VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: DEFERRED OUTFLOWS OF RESOURCES - LOSS ON REFUNDING

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT IS HELD BY AN UNRELATED ORGANIZATION, COMMUNITY FIRST FOUNDATION, FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE SCHOOL. THE FUNDS ARE USED TO SUPPORT THE MISSION OF PEAK TO PEAK CHARTER SCHOOLS.
REVENUES OF AFFILIATE REPORTED ON SEPARATE RETURN 264,855. INTERCOMPANY ELIMINATIONS 1,422,517.
CONTRIBUTION FROM FRIENDS OF PEAK TO PEAK 422,849. DISPOSAL OF FIXED ASSETS -54,178.

EXPENSES OF AFFILIATE REPORTED ON SEPARATE RETURN 146,400. CAPITAL OUTLAY 406,431. INTERCOMPANY ELIMINATIONS 1,422,517. AMORTIZATION OF BOND PREMIUM -126,230. CHANGE IN ACCRUED INTEREST 11,098. BOND PRINCIPAL PAYMENTS 740,000.
DEPRECIATION EXPENSE 826,862.

PEAK TO PEAK CHARTER SCHOOLS, INC. DOES NOT PUBLICIZE ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY THROUGH MEDIA, BUT THE SCHOOL ADOPTED BOULDER VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT'S EQUAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES POLICY, POSTED ON BOTH THE SCHOOL AND BOULDER VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT'S WEBSITES.
THE SCHOOL RECEIVES FEDERAL AND STATE AID.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: COLORADO EDUCATIONAL AND CULTURAL FACILITIES AUTHORITY (CECFA)

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: ADVANCE REFUND OUTSTANDING BONDS USED TO CONSTRUCT EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ISSUER NAME: COLORADO EDUCATIONAL AND CULTURAL FACILITIES AUTHORITY (CECFA) DATE THE REBATE COMPUTATION WAS PERFORMED: 07/23/2019

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S MEMBERSHIP INCLUDES PARENTS OR LEGAL GUARDIANS OF A CHILD ENROLLED IN THE SCHOOL, FACULTY, STAFF, ADMINISTRATION AND SUBSCRIBERS TO THE PROPOSAL OF THE SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S MEMBERSHIP ELECTS THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S MISSION AND BYLAWS MAY BE AMENDED OR REPEALED ONLY BY VOTE OF THE GENERAL MEMBERSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING BODY DID NOT DELEGATE AUTHORITY TO A COMMITTEE TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY MANAGEMENT. ONCE A DRAFT OF THE FILING IS AVAILABLE, THE RETURN IS SENT TO THE SCHOOL'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS WHO REVIEWS IT FIRST, THEN PROVIDES IT TO THE BOARD TREASURER FOR REVIEW BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PEAK TO PEAK IS GOVERNED BY A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY CREATED BY THE BOULDER VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT. THE POLICY CAN BE VIEWED ON THE BOULDER VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT WEBSITE. IF AND WHEN MEMBERS HAVE A PERSONAL INTEREST IN A SITUATION THAT COMES BEFORE THE BOARD, THEY SHALL DISCLOSE THE CONFLICT TO THE REST OF THE BOARD, RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM ALL DISCUSSIONS ON THE MATTER, AND ALSO REFRAIN FROM VOTING ON THE MATTER EXCEPT AS NEEDED FOR A QUORUM, AND AS EXPLAINED IN THE POLICY DOCUMENT. ADDITIONALLY, THEY SHALL NOT ATTEMPT TO INFLUENCE OTHER BOARD MEMBERS ON THE MATTER. BOARD MEETING MINUTES WILL REFLECT THE BOARD MEMBER'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE, AND VOTING ON THE MATTER WILL REFLECT THAT THE BOARD MEMBER RECUSED HIM OR HERSELF FROM THE DISCUSSION AND VOTE. BOARD MEMBERS WHO HAVE QUESTIONS ABOUT SITUATIONS THAT MAY PRESENT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST SHOULD DISCUSS THOSE QUESTIONS WITH THE BOARD PRESIDENT AND THE REST OF THE BOARD AS APPROPRIATE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD SETS THE SALARIES FOR PRINCIPALS, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF EDUCATION, AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS BASED ON AN ESTABLISHED COMPENSATION SYSTEM THAT FACTORS IN PERFORMANCE, LENGTH OF SERVICE, AND MARKET SALARY DATA. ONCE THE SALARIES ARE DETERMINED, THE BOARD APPROVES THEM AND OFFER LETTERS ARE GRANTED. THIS DISCUSSION AND DECISION IS DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES. THIS LAST TOOK PLACE IN 2021. FOR NON-ADMINISTRATOR STAFF, THEIR SALARIES ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE SAME METHOD DESCRIBED ABOVE BY THE PRINCIPALS, EDO, EDE, AND HUMAN RESOURCES DIRECTOR. THIS LAST TOOK PLACE IN 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE SCHOOL'S WEBSITE.

OTHER PROFESSIONAL SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 1,498,399. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 1,447,586. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 2,945,985. PURCHASED SERVICES FROM BOULDER VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 140,000. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 140,000.
NET CHANGE IN PENSION LIABILITY 6,450,920. CHANGE IN OPEB LIABILITY 84,766. CHANGE IN COMPENSATED ABSENCES -238,505.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 1: EXPLANATION OF METHOD OF ACCOUNTING
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL FOLLOWS A MODIFIED ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING. THE SCHOOL-WIDE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE REPORTED USING THE ECONOMIC RESOURCES MEASUREMENT FOCUS AND THE ACCRUAL BASIS OF ACCOUNTING. GRANTS AND SIMILAR ITEMS ARE RECOGNIZED WHEN ALL ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS IMPOSED BY THE PROVIDER HAVE BEEN MET.
THE PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED.
